summary: The Baseball Diplomacy Act aims to ease restrictions on Cuban baseball players entering the United States. It waives certain prohibitions related to the Cuban embargo, immigration laws, and the Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity (LIBERTAD) Act of 1996 for Cuban nationals coming to play professional baseball. The bill specifies visa durations tied to the baseball season and valid player contracts. The bill was introduced to the House of Representatives on March 27, 2025.
